title: Add Waysact exception for single quote -> double quote
body: Based on discussion in new-backend-dev, we prefer sticking to one style of quoting strings... rather than single quotes in JS and double quotes in JSX as suggested by this style guide.

title: Added Huballin to the Into the Wild section
body: Here's some of love :) Nice document we're really happy to implement it

title: Rename jshintrc to .jshintrc
body: According to http://jshint.com/docs/, the "special file" to configure JSHint is named `.jshintrc`, not `jshintrc`.

title: add constructor as an alias for componentWillMount
body:
As far as we can use ES6+ syntax, we should add it to the styleguide.
See details here http://babeljs.io/blog/2015/06/07/react-on-es6-plus/

what do you think?

title: Consistent Use Of Trailing Commas for ES5 and ES6
body:
Allowing trailing commas as part of the ES6 style guide was justified in #323 by arguing that transpiling ES6 code using `babel`, which strips trailing commas, mitigates issues with older browsers.

However, it's quite standard practice to run tools, like `uglify`, against ES5 code prior to shipping the code. Tools like `uglify` also eliminate trailing commas, effectively providing the same issue mitigation afforded by `babel`.

Could the use of `uglify` be justification for allowing trailing commas in ES5 code (bringing ES5 style closer inline with the ES6 style)?

title: Proper ESLint React components order validation
Immutable Rule in for-of loop using 'const'
body: In [11.1](https://github.com/airbnb/javascript#11.1), it is mentioned that `for-of` loops should not be used because it could violate the immutable rule. What is you are using `const` instead of `let` for the value inside the `for-of` loop?

title: Fixed contradiction in the Comments section
body:
Section 17.2 in the style guide says to leave an empty line above a single-line comment, but I found two instances where that was not followed. Ironically, both instances happen in the same section (Section 17).

https://github.com/airbnb/javascript#17.2

"Use `//` for single line comments. Place single line comments on a newline above the subject of the comment. **Put an empty line before the comment.**"

title: Move babel-eslint to peer dependencies
body: The reason for this is that config is something that is mixed in into a main config. And main project not necessarily has babel-eslint in there. Internal dependency of eslint-config-airbnb is ignored (it is not a module, rules/keys are just mixed in by eslint), so when you run lint there is an error that "babel-eslint is not found".

title: ES5 Type Casting
React style changes
body:
- Private internal methods, since methods can be exposed. Although using exposed methods is rare, it still should be clear.
- No .jsx file extensions, since JSX is just Javascript eventually.

title: Add Blendle to list of organizations
body: Add Blendle to list of organizations

title: Plural Jedi is Jedi.  Sorry, had to do it.  :)
body: Re ticket #408.

title: Typo in README.md.  Plural of Jedi is Jedi :)
body:
Sorry, had to say it.  There are a lot of geeks who might be angry.   

``` javascript
const obj = {
      episodeOne: 1,
      twoJedisWalkIntoACantina: 2,   // twoJediWalkIntoACantina
      lukeSkywalker,
      episodeThree: 3,
      mayTheFourth: 4,
      anakinSkywalker,
    };
```

title: use leading plus for string concatenation
body: i had some code where i occasionally had to add and remove strings, much like the typical work on multi-line arrays. using leading plus made much nicer diffs. same reason in section 19.2 for leading commas.

title: ECMAScript 6 and Block Scope
body: Add block scope to let & const bullet under ECMAScript 6 Styles section or give it its own overview and link.

- Fixed a few typos within the README files.

Vadzim.

title: Update to warn against Function constructor
body:
Added section 7.9 to warn against using the Function creator, as it opens similar vulnerabilities as eval.
Originally suggested in pull request #395.

No other lines were edited or removed.

title: Update to include warning against using eval.
body:

No other lines were edited or removed.
